text: Hi guys, today I'm going to show you how
to buy the best fish, and the best fish
of course, is fresh and of the highest
quality, but at the same time we need to
take care. Many of our oceans are
overfished, so, therefore if you buy a
piece of fish make sure it has been
caught in a sustainable, in a responsible
way, and if you buy a piece of wild
caught fish, look for the certificate of
the Marine Stewardship Council, which you
can recognise with this label.
For pre-packed fish, it's easy to recognise
on fresh, on frozen or on tinned. So, if
you visit your fishmonger store, make
sure it's a sustainable store. You
can buy fish fillets over there, but
better is to buy a whole piece of fish.
Why? You can recognise the freshness and
it's no waste. So, if you want to buy
fresh fish make sure the eyes are bright
the gills are red, and the skin is shiny.
And you can sniff the fish because fresh
fish doesn't smell. Good luck and enjoy
and if you want to see more tips
click on the link.
